sen.j: 秦綱手（はだのつなて、生年不明 - 天武天皇9年（680年）5月21日）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HADA no Tsunate (秦綱手, date of birth unknown - May 21, 680) is a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.
HADA no Tsunate (date of birth unknown - May 21, 680) lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
HADA no Tsunate (date of birth unknown - May 21, 680) lived in the Asuka period of Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.
The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.
The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は造、死後に忌寸。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko, and shifted to Imiki after his death.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko, and shifted to Imiki after his death.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko, and shifted to Imiki after his death.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側についた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
Daikinjo (the seventh grade of twenty-six of cap rank, which corresponds to Shoshii, Senior Fourth Rank and Jushii, Junior Fourth Rank of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), posthumously conferred
He was given posthumously the rank of Daikinjo.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一します。他の記事で「位」の上にわざわざ位階制度の説明がついているものがありました。この記事にはそのような説明はないので訳も不要と思われます。
sen.e: He was given posthumously the rank of Daikinjo.

sen.j: 秦氏は渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: The Hata clan was immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Hada (Hata) clan was immigrants to ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 「はだ」さんについての記事なので「はだ」を先にします。
sen.e: The Hada (Hata) clan was immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』が壬申の乱を記述するくだりに綱手の名は現れない。
sen.e: The name of Tsunate is not mentioned in the description of the Jinshin War in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The name of Tsunate is not mentioned in the description of the Jinshin War in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The name of Tsunate is not mentioned in the description of the Jinshin War in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 天武天皇9年（680年）5月21日に死に、壬申の年の功により大錦上の位を贈られた。
sen.e: He died on May 21, 680, and Daikinjo rank was given to him for his service in the year of Miaunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac).
sen.cmt: 大錦上: ウェブの用語を使用しました。
sen.e: He died on May 21, 680, and he was given the rank of Daikinjo for his service in the year of Jinshin (the Jinshin War).
He died on May 21, 680, and he was given the rank of Daikinjo for his service in the year of Jinshin (the Jinshin War).

sen.j: それから16年後の持統天皇10年（696年）5月3日に、大錦上秦造綱手が忌寸の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: 16 years later, on May 3, 696, Daikinjo HADA no Miyatsuko Tsunate was given Imiki rank.
sen.cmt: 大錦上: ウェブの用語を使用しました。
sen.e: Sixteen years later, on May 3, 696, Daikinjo HADA no Miyatsuko Tsunate was given the kabane of Imiki.
Sixteen years later, on May 3, 696, Daikinjo HADA no Miyatsuko Tsunate was given the kabane of Imiki.

sen.j: 事情は不明だが、遺族の申請によるものかと推測する説がある。
sen.e: Though the circumstances haven't been clear, some surmise this was because his family applied for it.
Although the reason of the reward is unknown, some scholar surmises this was because his family had applied for it.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Although the reason of the reward is unknown, some scholar surmises this was because his family had applied for it.
